page.title: 12WOOSEHILL'S CHANGING SCENE
page.content: The Woosehill area of Wokingham has changed drastically in the past 6 years.Old inhabitants recall woods, fields and farms,where now are roads and hundreds of new homes. The Riverside Walk has been retained as an area of open space, but many feel the houses are too crowded and much more is needed in the way of play area for children. On the edge of the estate stands a C15 timber framed cottage, once a dairy farm,which provides an element of contrast.It is in the process of being restored,and the present owners propose to open it to school parties as an educational resource.At the opposite side of the road is the Safeway shop and community centre with its doctors'surgery.
